thread.section_title: Garth Crooks slams Jose Mourinho for ‘utterly shameful’ actions against Middlesbrough – Metro
thread.title: Garth Crooks slams Jose Mourinho for ‘utterly shameful’ actions against Middlesbrough
thread.title_full: Garth Crooks slams Jose Mourinho for ‘utterly shameful’ actions against Middlesbrough

author: George Bellshaw
title: Garth Crooks slams Jose Mourinho for ‘utterly shameful’ actions against Middlesbrough
text:
Was Mourinho disrespectful? (Picture: Getty) Garth Crooks has slammed Jose Mourinho as ‘utterly shameful’ for disappearing down the tunnel early during Manchester United ’s 3-1 away win against Middlesbrough.
David Luiz provides major update on three-month knee injury The former Tottenham Hotspur man, who played for the Red Devils in the 1983/84 season, was desperately unimpressed with the former Chelsea and Real Madrid coach for showing what he perceived as a lack of respect for Boro head coach Steve Agnew.
And Crooks believes that Manchester United’s board members should remind Mourinho of the traditions associated with the club.
He told the BBC: ‘To see United boss Jose Mourinho disappear down the tunnel before the final whistle shaking both fists in total delight at the apparent three points was for me utterly shameful.
Crooks was unimpressed (Picture: Getty) ‘What happens to head coach Steve Agnew in future, or Middlesbrough Football Club for that matter is, at this moment, in the balance but Agnew did deserve to receive a handshake from the Manchester United manager at the end of the game as tradition demands.
‘This is Manchester United Football Club and it has a long and proud history of doing things properly.
More: Football Kylian Mbappe responds to Man Utd and Arsenal transfer links 
Thibaut Courtois admits this Chelsea star constantly cons the officials 
Jamie Redknapp names the TWO teams who will miss out on the top four 
‘I hope the United board have the courage to remind their employee who he represents.
‘Sir Alex Ferguson, with all his tantrums, always respected the traditions of the game and would never have behaved in such a manner.’
MORE: Man United must beat AC Milan and Juventus to Semedo
